intro: Alsomitra beccariana, commonly known as the Bornean alsomitra, is a climbing plant native to the rainforests of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Araliaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows as a vine, using its tendrils to climb towards sunlight. Its fruits are follicles that release seeds through a unique mechanism involving a spiral twist. This species is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and potential medicinal properties.
